body:
Chris, thank you for the reply and the upgrade of HR ratio calculator.  I want you to notice some more issues: 1) first of all, if I connect the barometric pressure (101325 Pa used by default) to the 3D chart, it appears an error: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/wbu4E-OwTjNuydp6NyFQwomImgWfCGBU*Q9ROsiKgaODuJoQzX4hBW2TYIySBDGNV6da*9JicnXGaz2X8yjxBCfN*XCuRcbi/Screenshot2016062711.09.19.jpg) 2) The problem with the display of the point in the 3D graph persists. Infact if I try to display the point of (x,y)=(24.05,0.006182) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/wbu4E-OwTjMcyoZo9yGKAkAncI1h4Q8Wsn7ogeOM9MhBRyMGLcABr0t*p7YGHbeuOKlFsoRwmO3Q-7DBxbCeR4Xcb5t*C7MY/2.JPG) in the rhino 3D chart it appears in a incorrect position because the Y axis is not alligned:
[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/wbu4E-OwTjOSC*QbWD9wB0yLpGnHRJUBMTkhrFsQQiyyHIjWSmu5VAx6SF39QggggEzirB1sZjSHoEJ2yQQhrszn-xCR-wJL/3.JPG) I can fix the starting value of humidity ratio with this: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/wbu4E-OwTjOvQb60fK64hxXh8aS3T3Yz7awaFSEK496I6KmZFj5TlwMFoej-SwiDGRuKIbUaMnP7P3DieEipz09hWINvpWML/4.JPG) So (as you can see) it is placed in the right place: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/wbu4E-OwTjNa8qf5E7yXPFNM9EE*Gn1lQeyIglJzRGKwEcv6r8OYAUW*uuPssrZjpBuLVY9fd9y1eaZwttt3wH4bhSvh4h-e/5.JPG)  Francesco
